Brooklyn Historical Society
Art Seidenberg collection of Prospect Park and Erasmus Hall High School postcards
Seidenberg, Art
2017.013
0.1 Linear Feet in three folders
1900-1935 The collection contains the postcards of Art Seidenberg, dating from approximately 1900 to 1929. They document the landscape, monuments, and structures of Prospect Park, the building and events of Erasmus Hall High School, and other buildings in Brooklyn. 1
Scope and Contents
The collection contains postcards of Prospect Park, Erasmus Hall High School, and miscellaneous buildings in Brooklyn. The postcards of Prospect Park vary from depicting the entrances and monuments to the Park, the boathouse, lake, and bridges, and the flower garden and zoo. There are also many postcards that contain scenic depictions of the park as a whole.
The miscellaneous postcards include images of the Brooklyn Botanical Garden, a rendering of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences, and the edifices of the 23rd Regiment Army, Greenwood Cemetary, and Pratt Institute.
The collection also contains postcards of Erasmus Hall High School. Those that are dated are dated between 1908-1929. The majority of the postcards of Erasmus Hall High School depict the outside of the building, as well as the original building from 1787, with one documenting an event called "The Indian Episode" at the school's 125th anniversary. Several of the postcards contain writing on the back detailing those individuals' visits to Erasmus Hall.
Arrangement
Folders arranged by subject at the collection level.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
All works published prior to 1923 are in the public domain. The copyright status for all other images has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Art Seidenberg, 2017.

Biographical / Historical
The donor, Art Seidenberg, lived in Brooklyn until he was twenty-two, and went to Erasmus Hall High School.
